newsitem.title: USA: HFS Inc signs definitive pact to buy Avis.
newsitem.headline: HFS Inc signs definitive pact to buy Avis.

text.p: HFS Inc said on Friday it signed a definitive agreement to buy Avis Inc for about $800 million.
The company said it expects to sign a contract with General Motors Corp next week to acquire GM's stock in Avis.

The Avis deal is still subject to the approval in late September of the employee participants in the Avis employee stock ownership plan and regulatory approvals. HFS said it expects the deal to close in October.

HFS also said it plans to pursue a possible follow-on acquisition of another rental car rental company and, during 1997, plans to take a majority interest in its rental car operating subsidiary public.
The company originally planned to spin off the Avis company-owned locations to shareholders immediately after the acquisition deal closed, HFS said.

"We fully intend that the Avis Rent A Car operations, and the operations of any potential related future acquisition, will become an independent public company during 1997 and will become our largest car rental franchise," said Henry Silverman, HFS chairman and chief executive.
